010package imagingbook.common.color.quantize;
011
012
013import java.util.AbstractQueue;
014import java.util.Arrays;
015import java.util.Comparator;
016import java.util.Locale;
017import java.util.PriorityQueue;
018
019import imagingbook.common.color.RgbUtils;
020import imagingbook.common.color.statistics.ColorHistogram;
021
022/**
023 * <p>
024 * This is an implementation of Heckbert's median-cut color quantization
025 * algorithm [1]. Unlike in the original algorithm, no initial uniform (scalar)
026 * quantization is used to for reducing the number of image colors. Instead, all
027 * colors contained in the original image are considered in the quantization
028 * process. After the set of representative colors has been found, each image
029 * color is mapped to the closest representative in RGB color space using the
030 * Euclidean distance. See Sec. 13.4.2 (Algs. 13.1-3) of [2] for details.
031 * </p>
032 * <p>
033 * The quantization process has two steps: first a {@link ColorQuantizer}
034 * instance is created from a given image using one of the constructor methods
035 * provided. This quantizer can then be used to quantize the original image or
036 * any other image using the same set of representative colors (color table).
037 * </p>
038 * <p>
039 * [1] Heckbert P., "Color Image Quantization for Frame Buffer Display", ACM
040 * Transactions on Computer Graphics (SIGGRAPH), pp. 297-307 (1982). <br>
041 * [2] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An
042 * Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
043 * </p>
044 * 
045 * @author WB
046 * @version 2022/10/05 revised to use PriorityQueue, made deterministic
047 */
048public class MedianCutQuantizer implements ColorQuantizer {
049        
050        /** The array of original (distinct) colors. */
051        private final ColorBin[] origColors;
052        /** The final color map (array of representative colors). */
053        private final float[][] colorMap;
054        
055        // -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
056        
057        /**
058         * Constructor, creates a new {@link MedianCutQuantizer} with up to K colors,
059         * but never more than the number of colors found in the supplied pixel data.
060         * 
061         * @param pixels an image as a aRGB-encoded int array
062         * @param K      the desired number of colors (1 or more)
063         */
064        public MedianCutQuantizer(int[] pixels, int K) {
065                if (K < 1) 
066                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("K must be at least 1");
067                this.origColors = getDistinctColors(pixels);
068                this.colorMap = (origColors.length > K) ?
069                                makeColorMap(findReferenceColors(K)) :  // more than K colors
070                                makeColorMap(origColors);                               // exactly K or fewer colors
071        }
072        
073        // -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
074        
075        @Override
076        public float[][] getColorMap() {
077                return this.colorMap;
078        }
079        
080        // -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
081        
082        /**
083         * Collects and returns the distinct colors found in the specified
084         * pixel array as an array of {@link ColorBin} instances.
085         * 
086         * @param pixels an array of aRGB-encoded color values
087         * @return an array of distinct colors
088         */
089        private ColorBin[] getDistinctColors(int[] pixels) {
090                ColorHistogram ch = new ColorHistogram(pixels, true);
091                final int nc = ch.getNumberOfColors();
092                ColorBin[] colors = new ColorBin[nc];
093                for (int i = 0; i < nc; i++) {
094                        int rgb = ch.getColor(i);
095                        int cnt = ch.getFrequency(i);
096                        colors[i] = new ColorBin(cnt, rgb);
097                }
098                return colors;
099        }
100
101        /**
102         * Performs the actual quantization and returns the calculated reference colors
103         * as an array of {@link #K} {@link ColorBox} instances. Color boxes are
104         * maintained in a sorted list (of type {@link PriorityQueue}) B whose sorting
105         * order is determined by the {@link ColorBox#compareTo(ColorBox)}. Boxes are
106         * iteratively split until the specified number of quantized colors is reached.
107         * In each step, the first color box (head element) of the sorted list is
108         * removed and two new boxes (the result of splitting) are added. Thus each step
109         * increases the size of list B by 1.
110         * 
111         * @return an array of reference colors
112         */
113        private ColorBox[] findReferenceColors(int K) {
114                final int n = origColors.length;
115                ColorBox cb0 = new ColorBox(0, n - 1, 0);
116                AbstractQueue<ColorBox> B = new PriorityQueue<>();      // the (ordered) set of quantized colors
117                
118                B.add(cb0);     
119                int k = 1;                                              // number of quantized color (color boxes)
120                boolean done = false;
121                
122                while (k < K && !done) {                // B.size() < K
123                        ColorBox cb = B.remove();       // take the first box from the queue // findBoxToSplit(B);
124                        ColorBox[] boxes = cb.splitBox();
125                        if (boxes != null) {            // this should never happen
126                                B.add(boxes[0]);
127                                B.add(boxes[1]);
128                                k = k + 1;
129                        }
130                        else {
131                                done = true;
132                        }
133                }
134                // B.size() == K
135                return B.toArray(new ColorBox[0]);      // sort?
136        }
137        
138        // --------------------------------------------------------
139        
140        @SuppressWarnings("unused")
141        private void listColorBoxes(AbstractQueue<ColorBox> boxes) {
142                if (boxes.isEmpty()) {
143                        System.out.println("boxes empty");
144                        return;
145                }
146                System.out.println("*** boxes " + boxes.size());
147                ColorBox[] all = boxes.toArray(new ColorBox[0]);
148                Arrays.sort(all);
149                for (int i = 0; i < all.length; i++) {
150                        System.out.println("    " + i + ": " + all[i].toString());
151                }
152        }
153        
154        // --------------------------------------------------------
155        
156        private float[][] makeColorMap(ColorBin[] colors) {
157                int n = colors.length;
158                float[][] map = new float[n][];
159                int i = 0;
160                for (ColorBin cn : colors) {
161                        map[i] = new float[] { cn.red, cn.grn, cn.blu };
162                        i++;
163                }
164                return map;
165        }
166        
167        private float[][] makeColorMap(ColorBox[] quantColors) {
168                int n = quantColors.length;
169                float[][] map = new float[n][];
170                int i = 0;
171                for (ColorBox cb : quantColors) {
172                        map[i] = cb.getAvgColor();
173                        i++;
174                }
175                return map;
176        }
177
178        // -------------- class ColorBin -------------------------------------------
179
180        private class ColorBin {
181                private final int red, grn, blu;
182                private final int cnt;
183                
184                private ColorBin(int cnt, int rgb) {
185                        this(cnt, RgbUtils.intToRgb(rgb));
186                }
187                
188                private ColorBin (int cnt, int[] rgb) {
189                        this.cnt = cnt;
190                        this.red = rgb[0];
191                        this.grn = rgb[1];
192                        this.blu = rgb[2];
193                }
194                
195                @Override
196                public String toString() {
197                        String s = ColorBin.class.getSimpleName();
198                        s = s + " red=" + red + " green=" + grn + " blue=" + blu + " count=" + cnt;
199                        return s;
200                }
201        }
202        
203        // -------------- non-static inner class ColorBox -----------------------------------
204
205        /**
206         * Represents a 'color box' holding a set of colors (of type {@link ColorBin}),
207         * which is implemented as a contiguous range of elements in array
208         * {@link MedianCutQuantizer#origColors}. Instances of {@link ColorBox} reference
209         * this array directly (this is why this class is non-static).
210         * Instances of this class are immutable.
211         */
212        private class ColorBox implements Comparable<ColorBox> { 
213                final int loIdx;                // lower index into 'imageColors'
214                final int hiIdx;                // upper index into 'imageColors'
215                final int level;                // split level of this color box
216                
217                final int count;                                // number of pixels represented by this color box
218                final float rmin, rmax;                 // range of contained colors in red dimension
219                final float gmin, gmax;                 // range of contained colors in green dimension
220                final float bmin, bmax;                 // range of contained colors in blue dimension
221                final float maxSpan;                    // largest side length of this color box 
222                final ColorDimension maxDim;    // color dimension of largest length
223                
224                ColorBox(int loIdx, int hiIdx, int level) {
225                        this.loIdx = loIdx;
226                        this.hiIdx = hiIdx;
227                        this.level = level;
228                        
229                        // trim this color box:
230                        int n = 0;      
231                        float rMin = MAX_RGB, gMin = MAX_RGB, bMin = MAX_RGB;
232                        float rMax = 0, gMax = 0, bMax = 0;             
233                        for (int i = loIdx; i <= hiIdx; i++) {
234                                ColorBin cn = origColors[i];
235                                n = n + cn.cnt;
236                                rMax = Math.max(cn.red, rMax);
237                                rMin = Math.min(cn.red, rMin);
238                                gMax = Math.max(cn.grn, gMax);
239                                gMin = Math.min(cn.grn, gMin);
240                                bMax = Math.max(cn.blu, bMax);
241                                bMin = Math.min(cn.blu, bMin);
242                        }
243                        this.rmax = rMax; this.rmin = rMin;
244                        this.gmax = gMax; this.gmin = gMin;
245                        this.bmax = bMax; this.bmin = bMin;
246                        this.count = n;
247                        
248                        // find the largest dimension of this color box
249                        float rd = rmax - rmin;
250                        float gd = gmax - gmin;
251                        float bd = bmax - bmin;
252                        float maxS = rd;
253                        ColorDimension maxD = ColorDimension.RED;
254                        if (bd >= rd && bd >= gd) {
255                                maxS = bd;
256                                maxD = ColorDimension.BLU;
257                        }
258                        else if (gd >= rd && gd >= bd) {
259                                maxS = gd;
260                                maxD = ColorDimension.GRN;
261                        }
262        
263                        this.maxSpan = maxS;
264                        this.maxDim = maxD;
265                }
266                
267                /**
268                 * Returns the number of different colors within this color box.
269                 * 
270                 * @return the number of different colors
271                 */
272                int colorCount() {
273                        return hiIdx - loIdx;
274                }
275                
276                /**
277                 * Splits this color box at the median point along its longest color dimension.
278                 * Modifies the original color box and creates a new one, which is returned.
279                 * 
280                 * @return A new color box.
281                 */
282                ColorBox[] splitBox() { 
283                        if (this.colorCount() < 2)      // this box cannot be split
284                                throw new RuntimeException("cannot split " + this.toString());
285                        
286                        int m = this.level;
287                        // find longest dimension of this box:
288                        ColorDimension dim = this.maxDim; // this.getMaxBoxDimension();
289                        // find median along dimension d
290                        int medIdx = this.findMedian(dim);
291                        // now split this box at the median return the resulting new boxes
292                        ColorBox cb1 = new ColorBox(loIdx, medIdx, m + 1);
293                        ColorBox cb2 = new ColorBox(medIdx + 1, hiIdx, m + 1);
294                        return new ColorBox[] {cb1, cb2};
295                }
296                                
297                /**
298                 * Finds the position of the median of this color box in RGB space along the
299                 * red, green or blue dimension, respectively.
300                 * 
301                 * @param dim the color dimension
302                 * @return the median value
303                 */
304                int findMedian(ColorDimension dim) {
305                        // sort color in this box along dimension dim:
306                        Arrays.sort(origColors, loIdx, hiIdx + 1, dim.comparator);
307                        // find the median index:
308                        int half = count / 2;
309                        int k, pixCnt;
310                        for (k = loIdx, pixCnt = 0; k < hiIdx; k++) {
311                                pixCnt = pixCnt + origColors[k].cnt;
312                                if (pixCnt >= half)
313                                        break;
314                        }                       
315                        return k;               // k = index of median
316                }
317                
318                /**
319                 * Calculates the (linear) average of the colors contained in this color box and
320                 * returns the result as a {@code float} vector. This is the 3D centroid (in RGB
321                 * color space) of the pixel colors represented by this box.
322                 * 
323                 * @return the average color for this box
324                 */
325                private float[] getAvgColor() {
326                        double rSum = 0;
327                        double gSum = 0;
328                        double bSum = 0;
329                        int n = 0;                              // pixel count for this color box
330                        for (int i = loIdx; i <= hiIdx; i++) {
331                                ColorBin cn = origColors[i];
332                                int cnt = cn.cnt;
333                                rSum = rSum + cnt * cn.red;
334                                gSum = gSum + cnt * cn.grn;
335                                bSum = bSum + cnt * cn.blu;
336                                n = n + cnt;
337                        }
338                        float avgRed = (float) (rSum / n);
339                        float avgGrn = (float) (gSum / n);
340                        float avgBlu = (float) (bSum / n);
341                        return new float[] {avgRed, avgGrn, avgBlu};
342                }
343
344                @Override
345                public String toString() {
346                        return String.format(Locale.US, 
347                                        "%s[lev=%1d lo=%5d hi=%5d cnt=%5d R={%.1f, %.1f} G={%.1f, %.1f} B={%.1f, %.1f} maxD=%s maxS=%.1f]", 
348                                        getClass().getSimpleName(), level, loIdx, hiIdx, count, 
349                                        rmin, rmax, gmin, gmax, bmin, bmax, maxDim.toString(), maxSpan);
350                }
351
352                /**
353                 * This method is required to satisfy the {@link Comparator} interface. It
354                 * determines how boxes are selected for splitting. The specific strategy is to
355                 * prefer color boxes at low levels. Boxes at the same level are selected based
356                 * on their maximum color span, i.e., their maximum side length in color space.
357                 * Finally, the number of pixels decides.
358                 */
359                @Override
360                public int compareTo(ColorBox other) {
361                        int v = Integer.compare(this.level, other.level);       // first compare by level (lower levels first)
362                        if (v != 0) return v;
363                        v = Float.compare(other.maxSpan, this.maxSpan);         // then compare by color span (larger spans first)
364                        if (v != 0) return v;
365                        v = Integer.compare(other.count, this.count);           // then compare by number of pixels (more pixels first)
366                        return v;
367                }
368        }
369        
370        /**
371         * Associates the color dimensions RED, GRN, BLU with the corresponding
372         * comparators (for sorting along selected color dimensions).
373         */
374        private enum ColorDimension {
375                RED (new Comparator<ColorBin>() {
376                        @Override
377                        public int compare(ColorBin colA, ColorBin colB) {
378                                return Float.compare(colA.red, colB.red);
379                        }}), 
380                GRN (new Comparator<ColorBin>() {
381                        @Override
382                        public int compare(ColorBin colA, ColorBin colB) {
383                                return Float.compare(colA.grn, colB.grn);
384                        }}), 
385                BLU (new Comparator<ColorBin>() {
386                        @Override
387                        public int compare(ColorBin colA, ColorBin colB) {
388                                return Float.compare(colA.blu, colB.blu);
389                        }});
390
391                private final Comparator<ColorBin> comparator;
392
393                // constructor:
394                private ColorDimension(Comparator<ColorBin> cmp) {
395                        this.comparator = cmp;
396                }
397        }
398        
399}
400
